summary: Calculates the concordance between genotype data of one sample in each of two VCFs - truth (or reference) vs. calls.

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: The name of the call sample within the call VCF. Not required if only one sample exists.
arguments.name: --CALL_SAMPLE

arguments.summary: The VCF containing the call sample
arguments.name: --CALL_VCF

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Default is false. If true, filter status of sites will be ignored so that we include filtered sites when calculating genotype concordance.
arguments.name: --IGNORE_FILTER_STATUS

arguments.summary: If true, multiple interval lists will be intersected. If false multiple lists will be unioned.
arguments.name: --INTERSECT_INTERVALS

arguments.summary: One or more interval list files that will be used to limit the genotype concordance.  Note - if intervals are specified, the VCF files must be indexed.
arguments.name: --INTERVALS

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Genotypes below this depth will have genotypes classified as LowDp.
arguments.name: --MIN_DP

arguments.summary: Genotypes below this genotype quality will have genotypes classified as LowGq.
arguments.name: --MIN_GQ

arguments.summary: Default is false, which follows the GA4GH Scheme. If true, missing sites in the truth set will be treated as HOM_REF sites and sites missing in both the truth and call sets will be true negatives. Useful when hom ref sites are left out of the truth set. This flag can only be used with a high confidence interval list.
arguments.name: --MISSING_SITES_HOM_REF

arguments.summary: Basename for the three metrics files that are to be written. Resulting files will be <OUTPUT>.genotype_concordance_summary_metrics, <OUTPUT>.genotype_concordance_detail_metrics, and <OUTPUT>.genotype_concordance_contingency_metrics.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: If true, output all rows in detailed statistics even when count == 0.  When false only output rows with non-zero counts.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_ALL_ROWS

arguments.summary: Output a VCF annotated with concordance information.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT_VCF

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: The name of the truth sample within the truth VCF. Not required if only one sample exists.
arguments.name: --TRUTH_SAMPLE

arguments.summary: The VCF containing the truth sample
arguments.name: --TRUTH_VCF

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: If true, use the VCF index, else iterate over the entire VCF.
arguments.name: --USE_VCF_INDEX

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Summary

Calculates the concordance between genotype data of one sample in each of two VCFs - one being considered the truth (or reference) the other being the call. The concordance is broken into separate results sections for SNPs and indels. Satistics are reported in three different files.

Details

This tool evaluates the concordance between genotype calls for a sample in different callsets where one is being considered as the \"truth\" (aka standard, or reference) and the other as the \"call\" that is being evaluated for accuracy. The Comparison can be restricted to a confidence interval which is typically used in order to enable proper assessment of False Positives and the False-Positive Rate (FPR).

Usage example

Compare two VCFs within a confidence region

 java -jar picard.jar GenotypeConcordance \\
       CALL_VCF=input.vcf \\
       CALL_SAMPLE=sample_name \\
       O=gc_concordance.vcf \\
       TRUTH_VCF=truth_set.vcf \\
       TRUTH_SAMPLE=sample_in_truth \\
       INTERVALS=confident.interval_list \\
       MISSING_SITES_HOM_REF = true

Output Metrics:

Output metrics consists of GenotypeConcordanceContingencyMetrics, GenotypeConcordanceSummaryMetrics, and GenotypeConcordanceDetailMetrics. For each set of metrics, the data is broken into separate sections for SNPs and INDELs. Note that only SNP and INDEL variants are considered, MNP, Symbolic, and Mixed classes of variants are not included.
  • GenotypeConcordanceContingencyMetrics enumerate the constituents of each contingent in a callset including true-positive (TP), true-negative (TN), false-positive (FP), and false-negative (FN) calls.
  • GenotypeConcordanceDetailMetrics include the numbers of SNPs and INDELs for each contingent genotype as well as the number of validated genotypes.
  • GenotypeConcordanceSummaryMetrics provide specific details for the variant caller performance on a callset including values for sensitivity, specificity, and positive predictive values.


Useful definitions applicable to alleles and genotypes:
  • Truthset - A callset (typically in VCF format) containing variant calls and genotypes that have been cross-validated with multiple technologies e.g. Genome In A Bottle Consortium (GIAB) (https://sites.stanford.edu/abms/giab)
  • TP - True-positives are variant sites that match against the truth-set
  • FP - False-positives are reference sites miscalled as variant
  • FN - False-negatives are variant sites miscalled as reference
  • TN - True-negatives are correctly called as reference
  • Validated genotypes - are TP sites where the exact genotype (HET or HOM-VAR) appears in the truth-set

VCF Output:

  • The concordance state will be stored in the CONC_ST tag in the INFO field
  • The truth sample name will be \"truth\" and call sample name will be \"call\"
name: GenotypeConcordance (Picard)
